title: goinstall usage output is confusing
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. run goinstall without argument.


What is the expected output?
[go@t-fedora15-64 ~]$ goinstall
usage: goinstall [flags] importpath ...
       goinstall [flags] -a
flags and default setting
  -a=false: install all previously installed packages
  -clean=false: clean the package directory before installing
  -dashboard=true: report public packages at http://godashboard.appspot.com/package
  -install=true: build and install
  -make=true: use make to build and install
  -nuke=false: clean the package directory and target before installing
  -u=false: update already-downloaded packages
  -v=false: verbose
[go@t-fedora15-64 ~]$


What do you see instead?

[go@t-fedora15-64 ~]$ 6g -V
6g version weekly.2011-08-17 9454
[go@t-fedora15-64 ~]$ goinstall
usage: goinstall importpath...
        goinstall -a
  -a=false: install all previously installed packages
  -clean=false: clean the package directory before installing
  -dashboard=true: report public packages at http://godashboard.appspot.com/package
  -install=true: build and install
  -make=true: use make to build and install
  -nuke=false: clean the package directory and target before installing
  -u=false: update already-downloaded packages
  -v=false: verbose
[go@t-fedora15-64 ~]$


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?


Which operating system are you using?


Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)


Please provide any additional information below.
